alert.note: Alert for Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 19 at 9:18PM PST until February 22 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TUESDAY TO 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches, except 8 to 14 inches possible up at Mt Ashland and Lake of the Woods. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph, strongest over exposed terrain and during Tuesday afternoon. * WHERE...Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades. This includes Siskiyou Summit on I-5, Lake of the Woods on highway 140 and Dead Indian Memorial Highway. * WHEN...From 4 AM Tuesday to 10 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates of one half to one inch per hour are possible Tuesday. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.

area.areaDesc: Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades
